content.text:
I'll start by exploring the codebase to understand the current state of the ClankerOS project.
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find . -type f -name "*.md" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && git log --oneline -10</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && ls -la</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find . -type f -name "*.c" -o -name "*.h" -o -name "*.s" | grep -v website | head -30</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat README.md 2>/dev/null | head -50</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the directory structure:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && tree -L 3 -I 'website|docs/outputs' 2>/dev/null || find . -type d -not -path '*/website/*' -not -path '*/docs/outputs/*' -not -path '*/.git/*' | head -30</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Now let me look at the recent documentation:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && ls -la docs/ 2>/dev/null</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find . -maxdepth 2 -type f \( -name "*.md" -o -name "Makefile" -o -name "TODO*" \) | sort</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the kernel source structure:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find . -path './website' -prune -o -path './docs/outputs' -prune -o -type f \( -name "*.c" -o -name "*.h" -o -name "*.s" -o -name "*.asm" \) -print | sort</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the git status to understand what's being worked on:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && git status</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Now let me examine the recent commit messages to understand context:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && git log --pretty=format:"%h - %s" -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the Makefile to understand the build system:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && head -100 Makefile</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me look at the kernel source files:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && ls -la kernel/ 2>/dev/null || echo "No kernel dir"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find . -path './website' -prune -o -path '*.git*' -prune -o -type d -print | grep -v website | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me search for any source files more directly:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find . -type f \( -name "*.c" -o -name "*.h" \) 2>/dev/null</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check what files exist in the root and first level directories:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find . -maxdepth 2 -type f | grep -v '.git' | sort</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Now let me understand the project structure better by checking the Makefile and any docs:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat Makefile</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check if there's a LEARNING.md or any documentation files:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && ls -la docs/</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find docs -type f -name "*.md" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the .gitignore to understand what source files might be excluded:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat .gitignore | head -50</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check if there's a src directory or similar:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find . -maxdepth 3 -type d | sort</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me examine the recent commits for context:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && git show --stat HEAD</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the Session 2 documentation mentioned in the recent commit:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find . -name "*Session*" -o -name "*TODO*" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me look at git log to see actual file changes:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && git log --name-only --oneline -5</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Perfect! Now I can see the source files. Let me examine them:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && ls -la src/</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find src -type f | sort</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the header files to understand the architecture:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat src/include/kernel.h</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat src/include/idt.h</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat src/include/gdt.h</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Now let me check the documentation files:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && ls -la docs/*.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat docs/CODING_STYLE.md | head -100</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check if there's any TODO file:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find . -name "*TODO*" -o -name "*todo*" | grep -v website</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the git diff to see uncommitted changes:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && git diff Makefile | head -50</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && git diff .gitignore | head -50</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me look at the main kernel files to understand the current implementation:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat src/kernel/kernel.c</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat src/boot/multiboot_header.asm</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the ISR and other system files:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && wc -l src/kernel/*.c src/arch/*.c src/arch/*.asm 2>/dev/null</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me examine the arch files:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat src/arch/x86_64/gdt.c | head -80</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat src/arch/x86_64/idt.c | head -80</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me look at the entry point:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat src/arch/x86_64/entry.asm</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Now let me check what documentation exists:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat docs/LEARNING.md | head -100</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check if there's a Session 2 file:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find docs -name "*[Ss]ession*" -o -name "*[Pp]art*"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the github workflows to see what was recently added:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && ls -la .github/ 2>/dev/null</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me look at the console implementation to understand the current state:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat src/drivers/console.c</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check if there are any existing tests or test infrastructure:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && find . -name "*test*" -type f | grep -v website</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me examine what libclankercommon provides:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat src/include/clanker_common.h</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Now let me check the ISR implementation:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat src/arch/x86_64/isr.c</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the ISR stubs:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && cat src/arch/x86_64/isr_stubs.asm</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check if there's any Doxyfile configuration that was recently added:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && head -50 Doxyfile</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me understand the full project structure by listing all tracked files:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros && git ls-files | grep -v website | sort</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Perfect! Now I have a comprehensive understanding of the project. Let me create a summary:

## Warmup Summary

I've successfully explored the ClankerOS project. Here's what I found:

### Project Overview
ClankerOS is an x86_64 OS kernel project built with a modular architecture. The recent commits show active development with focus on:
- Multiboot header implementation and kernel entry point refinement
- GDT (Global Descriptor Table) setup
- IDT (Interrupt Descriptor Table) and ISR (Interrupt Service Routine) implementation
- Early console support via VGA
- Integration with libclankercommon printf functionality

### Current Architecture

**Source Structure:**
- `/src/boot/` - Bootloader components (multiboot header)
- `/src/arch/x86_64/` - Architecture-specific code (GDT, IDT, ISR, entry point)
- `/src/kernel/` - Core kernel code
- `/src/drivers/` - Driver implementations (console/VGA)
- `/src/include/` - Header files and interfaces

**Key Files:**
- `kernel.c` - Main kernel entry point
- `entry.asm` - x86_64 assembly entry point
- `gdt.c/h` - Global Descriptor Table implementation
- `idt.c/h` - Interrupt Descriptor Table implementation
- `isr.c/isr_stubs.asm` - Interrupt handling
- `console.c` - VGA console driver
- `clanker_common.h` - Interface to libclankercommon (printf, etc.)

### Build System
- Uses Makefile for compilation
- Targets x86_64 architecture
- Produces multiboot-compliant kernel binary

### Documentation
- Comprehensive coding style guide (`CODING_STYLE.md`)
- Learning materials (`LEARNING.md`)
- Setup documentation for website generation
- Doxygen configuration for API documentation

### Git Status
- Modified: `.gitignore`, `Makefile`
- New files: `.github/` directory, website setup files, documentation generation scripts
- Recent focus on documentation infrastructure and coding standards

I'm now ready to assist with any implementation tasks. What would you like me to help plan?
